content:
Interesting clash, but it is harder than it should be.

I've made some edits to the statement to make it clearer:

"Given a time [[T]] (<<12-hour format, HH:MM>>) a number [[H]], and a number [[M]], output the smallest angle between the <<hour hand and minute hand according to [[T]]>>, the <<hour hand according to [[T]] and hour hand according to [[H]]>>, and the <<minute hand according to [[T]] and minute hand according to [[M]]>>.  All angles should be in degrees.

<<NOTE:>> For every minute, the hour hand will also move an equal distance to the next hour value.  For example, given a time [[T]] of 09:15, the angle of the hour hand will NOT be horizontal.  [[H]] and [[M]] are independent, so when calculating the angle between the hour hand according to [[T]] and the hour hand according to [[H]], consider the time to be [[H]] o'clock."

I also edited the stub generator so that H and M are input as integers rather than 'string(2)' as before.

This is still quite a hard clash, even with a clear statement.  In my clash just now, I was the only human player to solve it and it took me over 10 minutes. https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/413115343dd7d395caa708411d3fb90f4ca5446

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and detailed puzzle with acceptable description & tests.

All sections: Please format the {{constants}} as [[variables]] instead.

Cases: The cases where M is "00" violate the constraint that 1 ≤ M ≤ 59.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I believe the contribution's description is clear and precise. I also think the challenge isn't too easy or too hard. Overall it looks good.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It looks fine

The constants are constant throughout the duration of the test, why should they be formatted as variables?

Thanks for that catch though, fixed it!

The given inputs are variable in the context of a puzzle, because they differ from case to case and are treated as variables in your code (where you may and you can define REAL constants). All CodinGame contributions work on this basis.
